rev.user: The Fat Man Who Never Came Back
rev.comment: /* Virginia Tech massacre */ removing out-of-place sentence. Ryan Stack killking is already described above
/* Media package sent to NBC */ "controversy" section merely references a message board. and besides, ALL major news outlets have made use of the materials, not just nbc
/* Attributed writings */ sorry, no. there has not yet been any direct connection made between that study's findings and cho. it does not belong here. also "implications" is used incorrectly.
/* Attributed writings */ created new subheading for profiling research
revert because Secret Service study is critical to understanding shooter's behavior
/* Reactions to writings */ irregluar comma usage in quotation marks. altering the context of the quote to make it more natural
/* Plays */ removing the "violent games"/"violent writings" comparison. it's just a jack thompson rebuttal and defence of video games. it has no significance here
RM Ninodeluz' removal... I will only bow to an experienced
«+{{fact}}» the lead paragraph and claims therein are not exempt from citations requirement
«" because" → ";"» remove uncited implication of causality
«"December 14, 2005" → "[[December 14]], [[2005]]", -",", "mental illness" → "[[mental illness]]"» wikilink full dates and link [[mental illness]]
There is your proof -- a court ruling. Its not an adjective. Its a point of legal fact. Please refrain from vandalizing other's contributions.
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Seinfeld01|Seinfeld01]] ([[User talk:Seinfeld01|talk]]) to last version by Ninodeluz
Its not an adjective/POV -- he had a history of mental problems and was in and out of facilities the last 5 years. He was not a normal member of society and it should be noted
/* Media package sent to NBC */ need to clarify what he was saying about Karr & Lafave i.e. They were bad people. Like his Mr. Brownstone Play ~~~~

I'm not sympathetic, I'm just against adjectives not based on a medical diagnosis that could be inaccurate. Check the page on wikipedia on Columbine and it says perpetrators, not "evil" or "disturbed"
Im not sure why the wiki user is sympathetic to this individual. Someone with his history of mental illness and goes on a murderous rampage can be classified as disturbed w/o much debate?
I removed "disturbed"... this is a POV, the same as with "evil". What does "disturbed" mean? Did he have a recent medical diagnose of mental illness? Adjectives there contribute to nothing! ~~~~
I deleted evil... Was he evil? Was he insane? What defines as person as evil? It almost sounds like an insult... no need to do that.
/* Behavior and mental health */ This sentence is uncited and I'm pretty sure it was Giovanni who had him removed, not Roy.
